sub_topic: Finding the vertex cover of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph: 

```
         1â€”2
        /   \
       3     4
      / \   / \
     5   6 7   8
```

What is the minimum number of vertices that can be chosen in order to cover all the edges of the above graph?
message_2:
The minimum number of vertices that can be chosen to cover all the edges of the given graph is 3. One possible set of vertices is {2, 3, 4}. With these vertices, all the edges are covered:

- Edge 1-2 is covered by vertex 2
- Edge 2-4 is covered by vertex 2
- Edge 2-3 is covered by vertex 3
- Edge 3-5 is covered by vertex 3
- Edge 3-6 is covered by vertex 3
- Edge 4-7 is covered by vertex 4
- Edge 4-8 is covered by vertex 4
